description:
Primary Purpose: 
The primary purpose of the Sales Manager is generation of revenue through direct sales activities for assigned market segment of the hotel.
Work Performed: 
The Sales Manager will be tasked with the following duties, responsibilities, and assignments:

 Solicit, negotiate and confirm new and repeat business through various efforts to maximize revenues to meet/exceed individual revenue goals;


 Prepare and execute sales contracts, event orders, group resumes to ensure quality product delivery and customer satisfaction;


 Coordinate all function details with clients to include but not limited to space requirements, meeting times, equipment, menus, billing, etc.;


 Develop and complete monthly SMART plan documenting measurable goals and action plans to ensure access;


 Identify potential customers, accounts and markets, develop new business, and cultivate existing relationships using sales activities to achieve the assigned revenue goal;


 Navigate through the sales process including qualifying, negotiating, closing and detailing group and/or catering leads;


 Review, evaluate and execute sales contracts with customers;


 Develop and maintain a file and trace system to ensure all sales call activity is defined, traced, and updated in an organized manner;


 Any and all other work as required to complete the primary purpose of the position.

Qualifications: 
Required Prior Experience: 
1-2 years of experience in Event Services, Banquet, Hotel Sales, Marketing or equivalent education and experience
Required Education: 
High School Diploma or Equivalent
Preferred Education: 
2+ years of college or 2+ years in a sales& marketing, front office, or other supervisory position
Required Technology: 
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Preferred Technology: 
Experience with Delphi, FDC, and/or Marriott CI/TY
Physical: 
8+ hours sitting at a desk and computer
Other: 
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Competencies: 
(38) Organizational Agility
Knowledgeable about how organizations work; knows how to get things done both through formal channels and the informal network; understands the origin and reasoning behind key policies, practices, and procedures; understands the cultures of organizations.
(37) Negotiating
Can negotiate skillfully in tough situations with both internal and external groups; can settle differences with minimum noise; can win concessions without damaging relationships, can be both direct and forceful as well as diplomatic; gains trust quickly of other parties to the negotiations; has a good sense of timing.
(15) Customer Focus
Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $50,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 401(k)
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Paid time off
 Vision insurance

Weekly day range:

 Monday to Friday

Experience:

 Hospitality: 2 years (Required)
 Sales Manager: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: One location

SetSchedule is now hiring for Local Inside Sales Representatives for our BRAND NEW office in Texas. SetSchedule values talented, self motivated people who are passionate about their accomplishments and the work that they do. With tools, technology and support from peers and management you will become very successful in this uncapped role within SetSchedule. We strongly believe in internal growth at SetSchedule, people who have started in this role are now helping to make decisions to help shape and grow SetSchedule.
Now is a great time to join our team as our industry and product is rapidly growing. We are a recognizable brand in our space with more and more users downloading and subscribing to our product. If you’re passionate about building strong partnerships with clients and coworkers, love to share ideas, solve problems and collaborate, we’d love to talk to you.
What we offer and some of the perks: 

 Base pay + Uncapped Commission
 2 Week paid training to get you set up for success. Continuous training afterwards
 Benefits include health, dental, vision, chiropractic, life
 Opportunities for career advancement. NEW office, lots of boots to fill
 A competitive, supportive work environment
 Rewards for top performers: bonuses (monthly, quarterly up to 21k)
 We offer exceptional employee benefits including; Medical, Dental, Vision, Chiropractic Insurance
 SetSchedule Team Events every month! (You do not want to miss out!)
 Monthly catered lunches

What will you do as an Inside Sales Representative?

 Facilitate steps of the sale, such as presenting our value proposition, learning their long term and short-term goals, submitting finance applications, and sticking with the customer through the process
 Maintaining a working knowledge of our products and appropriately recommending them to our valued clients
 Create and initiate Sales opportunities through cold communications
 Present SetSchedule Products and Promotions, through training and demonstrations for optimal customer understanding
 Working with the company and other sales reps in ongoing training and development with the goals of raising both individual and group performance.

Who is SetSchedule?
SetSchedule as a company creates a positive and energetic work environment for all our staff that allows you to advance and continue to add value. We thrive and evolve off feedback from our employees to help set everyone up for success in their role. We work in a team environment, with an emphasis on open dialog, transparency, constructive feedback, and quick action. Our proven success by believing in investing in our employees, is one of the reasons we were named Best Workplaces three years in a row.
Honored in the top 200 of INC Magazines 5000 fastest-growing companies, and Entrepreneur Magazine's 360 companies to watch in America, SetSchedule provides a comprehensive, global tech solution for the real estate industry. We use machine learning, and AI tech to improve business and enhance the experience of our customer base. We are always striving to be better, and we are looking for the best and brightest talent to help us shape this new Role!
You will need: 

 Enjoy learning, as well as being coached and challenged
 Enthusiastic self-starter, with a strong drive to succeed
 Strong technological skills
 Must possess outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
 Hunter Mentality
 Experience in Cold communications, Client limitations, and inside sales a PLUS!

Welcome to SetSchedule, we appreciate your consideration and look forward to your application.
*Please be sure you have an up-to-date email on your resume, as our first communications will be via email.
* We generally reach out to all candidates within the first 3 days, Should you not hear from us please check spam.
**There is mandatory of at least 2 weeks of paid training. The training will be held in our new Plano office.**

description:
Are you a sales hustler looking to work in a fast-paced environment?
We are looking for a passionate go-getter who is interested in joining our growing team of Account Executives. In this position, you will work directly with existing clients and new prospects to better understand their individual needs and pitch how our products and services can help them meet and exceed their goals and expectations.
As a successful Account Executive, you must be proactive in addressing client’s needs through excellent communication and negotiations skills.
Account Executive Responsibilities: 

 Organize regular client meetings to ensure excellent customer service and identify additional opportunities for the company to provide products, services, or solutions.


 Make cold calls and actively reach out to prospects and referrals from existing clients.


 Monitor sales account representatives and conduct performance audits.


 Establish best practices and consistently monitor and report sales performance analytics.


 Maintaining a database of contact information.

What’s in it for you: 

 Competitive comp plan and performance-based incentives.


 Flexible work hours.


 Career advancement opportunities.


 Best-in-class training, extensive support, and mentorship program.

Account Executive Requirements: 

 A successful track record of hitting and exceeding weekly, monthly, and annual quotas.


 Flexible and open to change in a fast-paced environment.


 Strong ability to work independently, solve client issues, and make decisions.


 Excellent communication, presentation, organizational, and time management skills.


 Computer savvy and capable of learning new computer applications.

Are you ready to explore a career with us as an Account Executive? We'd be delighted to have you on board! Send your application today to secure your spot.

Southern Botanical is looking for an experienced Landscape Account Manager to join the Southern Botanical in the Carrollton area.
Summary: 
A successful candidate will direct production and ensure quality control for assigned accounts. The candidate is result-oriented, organized and client-focused.
Responsibilities: 
· Manage and motivate assigned frontline team members to meet company standards
· Ensure the timely and successful delivery of solutions according to client needs and objectives
· Maintain contracts and renewal of all managed accounts
· Identify and recommend upgrades in client gardens to improve aesthetics and function
· Serve as the primary contact and respond to our client's requests and concerns
· Responsible for sales goals which include landscape enhancements, agronomy, irrigation, and tree care
· Must be able to negotiate and provide excellent customer service
· Understand mechanics of a basic irrigation system, know how to program and accurately adjust schedules for a controller and make basic repairs (drip, heads, nozzles, troubleshooting)
· Understand common terms, operations, and procedures for agronomy, arboriculture, enhancements, & irrigation
Requirements: 
· Bachelor’s degree and or 3 years of experience (preferably in the landscape industry)
· Valid Driver's License
· Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
· Must be able to lift 30 lbs and walk, stand, kneel or bend for extended periods of time
Perks: 
· 401K with company match
· Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance
· Paid-Time Off
· Holiday Pay
· Recognition programs and performance bonuses
· Continuing education and industry involvement opportunities
Why SoBo: 
For more than two decades Southern Botanical "SoBo" has built a reputation for creativity, quality and integrity throughout North Texas and beyond. Behind every signature landscape, you'll find our total dedication to client satisfaction and the people who achieve it. We've experienced explosive growth as a result and enjoy sharing that success with our team members. We pride ourselves in having a national reputation for quality and extraordinary customer service.

The Clinical Sales Account Manager will focus on building new business for the Clincial Diagnostics laboratory. They will be able to achieve individual and team revenue and sales objectives through proactive communication. Previous Medical/Diagnostics sales experience required.
· Implement the strategic sales plan for the DFW region to meet/advance the company's objective, to develop new business and maintain/grow key client business relationships, to support the growth of the organization

· Able and willing to work from the office and travel throughout the DFW territory

Position: Director of Sales - Holiday Inn Bedford, TX
  Mission Statement
  Esperanto Developments is a dynamic hospitality management company which brings success to all its stakeholders.
  We achieve this with a diverse and talented team by exceeding expectations of guests, associates and owners.
  We bridge the gap between risk and reward providing tools and confidence to take on bigger and bolder opportunities.
  We pride ourselves on building strong partnerships never losing sight that profitability begins with people and relationships.
  Vision Statement 
 Esperanto Developments Vision is to be recognized as an innovative market leader changing the hospitality industry. We lead on a path to meaningful growth and make positive impact in the lives of all. 
 Esperanto Development LLC. Is a leading hotel management company with a premier track record of maximizing profitability and improving asset values for hotel owners. From hotel operations and property management to electronic distribution and interactive marketing, Esperanto Development achieves superior operating results through its strong commitment to guests, associates and owners.
  Job Description: 
 The Director of Sales is responsible for all sales efforts and supports revenue management initiatives. This position is the revenue driver through the delivery and execution of the strategic plan, leadership of the sales department, and developing and strengthening alliances and relationships within the marketplace.
  Required Skills and Requisites:
 
   Excellent communication skills. Ability to convey information and ideas through a variety of media; engaging the audience and helping them understand and retain the message. Skilled at establishing effective relationships with customers and internal partners; promoting openness, trust and confidence in one's intentions. Requires effective reading, writing and oral comprehension.
   Driven sales and marketing acumen. Energetic, proactive, takes calculated risks, and perseveres to attain goals. Possess an extensive knowledge of sales, marketing, revenue management and budget analysis capabilities with a demonstrated ability to apply these principles and methods through strategy and tactics.
   Thorough understanding of hotel revenue management. Knowledge of total hotel revenue management concepts, processes and strategies (including sales cycles and trends, account management, pricing, and inventory management).
   Administration and management capabilities with fiduciary responsibilities. - Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
   Leadership qualities. Skilled at building a cohesive team and facilitating goal accomplishment by aligning individual and team actions with strategies and plans to drive business results. Requires the ability to inspire confidence and gain respect of hotel team, industry partners, competitors, and owners.
   Service orientation. Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
   Applied business knowledge including bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Hotel, and Restaurant Management, or related major plus three or more years experience in hotel sales and marketing.
 
  Responsibilities and Duties:
 
   Functions as the strategic business leader of the hotel's sales and marketing department and is responsible for all property-related reactive sales activity, proactive account sales and targeted segmentation, local and social catering sales and business travel sales, as well as positioning and promotional planning and activities. The position shares responsibility for achieving revenue goals, guest and associate satisfaction and the financial performance of the department.
   Develops and implements the sales and marketing business plan and annual budget. Analyze competition, market trends and customer needs and comments, forecasts, etc. to continually assess the productivity against budget, plan, and market.
   Direct the sales operation to meet / exceed revenue goals while ensuring a positive guest experience. Holds sales team accountable for achievement of revenue performance and activity goals.
   Develop and continually enhance relationships with key corporate, business and travel accounts, community organizations and professional associations to maintain visibility and market share. Continually targets and prospects new business through individual creativity and innovation
   Represents the Hotel positively and effectively in the marketplace.
   Proactively position and market the property. Manages the marketing budget to enable development of hotel specific campaigns, promotions and collateral to drive revenue and meet property objectives. Interfaces with brand support services and regional sales and marketing communications to ensure promotions pull through.
 
  At Esperanto Developments, we are dedicated to creating and sustaining meaningful hospitality careers for our associates. We support our associates with highly competitive salaries, outstanding health, benefits, extensive training and development programs, promotion within the organization, and a positive team-based culture where people make the difference. 
 Esperanto Developments, is an equal opportunity employer with policies prohibiting unlawful discrimination on the basis of any protected classification under applicable local, state and/or federal laws, which can include race, color, creed, sex, national origin, age, veteran status or physical or mental disability unrelated to job requirements. 
 Esperanto Development policies also provide for a drug-free workplace, where the use, possession, or influence of illegal drugs or alcohol while on company time is generally prohibited. An employee's use (or abuse) of legally prescribed medication may also implicate company policy, where it impairs judgment or work performance or otherwise creates workplace safety risks.

description:
We are looking to fill an immediate opening for a highly organized and experienced Independent Sales Associate with a passion for preparing, negotiating, and closing deals. As an Independent Sales Associate, you'll be responsible for adjusting your selling strategy to meet sales goals, look for clients through networking and cold calling, and offer outstanding after-sales and support assistance.
Independent Sales Associate Responsibilities: 

 Generate leads, build a personal network, and schedule appointments for product presentations and pitches.


 Customize sales presentations to suit the client’s needs and highlight specific benefits of our products and services.


 Understand the client’s pain points and offer solutions from the company’s product line and services.


 Nurture prospective customers by following up with high-quality referrals from existing clients.

What’s in it for you: 

 Competitive pay and performance-based incentives.


 Flexible work hours.


 Career advancement opportunities.


 Free sales training, extensive support, and mentorship program.

Who we are looking for: 

 Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to effectively communicate and share information.


 Maintain a professional attitude, with sincerity and enthusiasm, when dealing with clients.


 Excellent negotiation and consultative sales skills.


 Strong organizational and time management skills

Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you. Start your application for the Independent Sales position to join an award-winning employer today!

JOB SUMMARY
The candidate will be highly motivated and show good organization skills. Must be a self-starter and need little supervision. The candidate must have a good grasp of the industry trends, which will become the bases for strategic planning and forecasting. The candidate will take a lead role in growing the practice through the promotion of brands and service offerings across business unit segments, industry niches and the firm overall. This role will create brand awareness and drive lead generation through strategic marketing initiatives using a mix of traditional, digital and content marketing campaigns. This person will play a major role in developing and implementing best practices in marketing, business development support and segment development for the firm.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
A. Identifies trendsetter ideas by researching industry and related events, publications, and announcements; tracking individual contributors and their accomplishments
B. Protects organization's value by keeping information confidential.
C. Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
D. Manage expectations and educate community partners and firm about marketing priorities, concepts and program rules.

N. Professional representation of Sunshine Care Centers.
O. Skill in prioritizing and triaging obligations.
P. Able to travel upon request.
Q. Ensuring ordering of supplies and food is conducted in a timely manner.
R. Any and all other duties/tasks as may be assigned from time to time.

2. Motivation for sales.
3. Ability to consistently show knowledge and ability to provide information about program.
4. Presentation skills.
5. Ability to work in multi-task environment.
6. Superior presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal

8. Ability to work in multi-task environments.

12. Ability to follow instructions and work as a team.

15. Understand the importance of self-awareness in one’s personal, professional, and cultural life.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORKING CONDITIONS
§ Ability to stand for long periods

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
§ Education:

- Valid driver’s license

We provide our clients with the deepest understanding of audiences—and we can't do that without our Panel Recruitment and Field Operations teams. They work in-person to build important connections with current panelists, who provide the vital data that powers businesses, and recruit new panelists.*HIRING IMMEDIATELY! Field Sales Representatives*
What are some Field Sales Representative responsibilities: 

 Conduct in-person interviews in panelist’s homes.
 Navigate secured buildings, gated communities, stairs, elevators, walkways and driveways (paved and unpaved) and a variety of entrances into a prospective participant's residence.
 Travel to selected homes within a territory using a company-provided vehicle.
 Approach statistically-selected homes (door to door) with or without an appointment.
 Persuade selected households over the phone and/or in person to participate in Nielsen TV, Radio and Computer Research.

What are the qualifications: 

 Enjoy meeting and interacting with all types of people.
 Demonstrate the ability to "sell” selected participants on the importance of participating in the Nielsen Ratings.
 Bring relevant work or volunteer experience that includes customer service, market research, education, census bureau research, in-field research, hospitality , social service, door-to-door sales, campaign canvassing, etc.
 Work and manage a non-traditional schedule that includes evenings and weekends.
 Meet minimum education requirements: High School Diploma or GED OR 2 + years equivalent work experience.
 Show proficiency using a tablet and smartphone including the use of e-mail, spreadsheets, and other computer applications.
 Have a valid driver’s license, and satisfactory driving record.
 Consistently meet individual performance metrics.

Physical Demands: 
The associate must be willing and able (with or without reasonable accommodation) to be outside, in all weather conditions, year-round going door-to-door into people’s homes. Be able to navigate stairs, elevators, walkways and driveways (paved and unpaved) and a wide variety of entrances into people’s homes. Willing and able to interact with people for several hours in their home - regardless of the location or condition of their home, this includes, but is not limited to homes that may contain pets, dust, plants, odors or other irritants of any kind, as well as be in various states of cleanliness or disarray.
Physical Requirements

 Travel Locally for up to 50% of the time
 Driving for up to 8 hours per day
 Standing for up to 6 hours per day
 Kneeling for up to 2 hours per day
 Ability to climb stairs
 Ability to walk half of a mile
 Ability to work in all seasons and inclement weather

Company Overview
  Lone Star Analysis is a rapidly growing company offering applied decision intelligence and engineering solutions to enhance innovation, create economic strength, and make the world safer. Since 2004, organizations have trusted Lone Star to deliver actionable answers to complex problems in manufacturing, aerospace, defense, energy, logistics, transportation, and communications.
  System Engineering & Integration Solutions group (SEIS), is a long-time leader with proven performance in the Aerospace and Defense industry providing faster, better solutions to government agencies, armed forces, and contractors providing strategic advantage when decisions really count.
  Job Description
  We are adding a new member to our SEIS team. The Business Development Manager will report to the Vice President, SEIS in Addison, Texas. The potential candidate should expect responsibility for business development pursuing new business, maximizing current customer relationships, and revenue growth for SEIS. Business Development in the areas of Systems Engineering services, Program Management, Intelligence Solutions, Test and Integration, software applications that define and support requirements, mission planning, Artificial Intelligence applications, systems integration, and simulation design requirements to support various Lone Star solutions. The Business Development Manager works closely with the SEIS team members to ensure successful delivery of all client requirements on time and on budget.
  We are currently seeking someone experienced in establishing and maturing client relationships, conducting market analysis, identifying potential clients, paths for future growth, and assisting with closing sales opportunities for our Systems Engineering and Integration Solutions lines of business. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Business Development and experience in Program Management, working with the US Military, Intelligence agencies, Foreign Ministries of Defense and/or Defense and Aerospace contractors. This position is instrumental to the company's future growth and diversification efforts.
  Responsibilities 
 
  Understands and can clearly articulate customer requirements with respect to systems engineering, requirements flow down, modeling and simulation, weapon testing, engineering services, sub-system testing and technical integration across all DoD services and contractors within the Aerospace/Defense Industry
   Understands Department of Defense and other government agencies acquisition process - including, but not limited to, reading/parsing RFPs and/or SOWs
   Self-directed and can sell services and solutions in a "make happen," non-program of record environment with little or no direction
   Comprehends and can clearly communicate Lone Star Analysis' full line of business offerings, capabilities, benefits, and competitive advantages
   Possess the knowledge and experience to prospect, develop leads, qualify opportunities, close business, and build relationships with new and existing clients within the defense and aerospace sectors
   Builds and maintains a robust pipeline of business opportunities that enable meeting sales targets and other critical business development metrics
   Possess strong communications and presentation skills that can be utilized in engaging potential customers as well as within Lone Star Analysis
   Possess excellent organizational skills
   Provides market feedback to the company leadership regarding competitive offerings, prospect needs and product development ideas
   Protects company proprietary, private, and competitive information
   Other duties as assigned.
 
  Key Requirements 
 
  Must be comfortable with the prospect of working across several industries (Aerospace, Defense, Manufacturing, Energy, Transportation, Logistics, and Telecom) and across several domains (Operations, T&E, Design and Development, Technology, and Others) as required.
   Excellent communications, negotiation, and sales skills
   Ability to see the big picture yet focus on small details
   Highly organized, technically skilled with Microsoft Office suite and Sales Force (or comparable CRM)
   Effective time management skills with attention to detail
   Must be highly collaborative and capable of working independently or in a team-based environment
   This position does require travel to client sites, up to 25% Travel CONUS/OCONUS
 
  Additional Qualities
 
   Experience using predictive analytical tools to optimize processes and operations
   Technical, specifically engineering and/or military background preferred
   Currently holds at least a US Government Secret clearance, or ability to obtain
 
  Education & Experience
 
   Must have at least a BS with equivalent experience with Masters' degree preferred
   Minimum 5 years of experience in Government contracting, acquisition, program management or technical management position
 
  Expectations do not include: 
 
  All of the desirable attribute within a single candidate.
 
 
  Why Lone Star? 
 Have you ever wanted to...Work on cutting edge issues? Experience what it feels like to have your work truly make a difference? Work in a high trust, high performance environment and feel valued? If the answer is 'yes' then Lone Star might be for you. There is one catch however, you can't hide in our culture. So, if we appeal to you, bring your 'A' game.

We exist for American workers and their employers - who are the backbone of our economy. That is where Centivo comes in - our mission is to bring affordable, high-quality healthcare to the millions of Americans who struggle to pay their healthcare bills.
 
  Centivo is looking for a Senior Sales Solution Consultant to join our team! 
  As a Senior Sales Solution Consultant you will partner with the Employer Solutions Lead, National Account Sales Executive and Chief Revenue Officer to support specific sales pursuits. 
  What you'll do: 
  
  In partnership with the National Account Sales Executive, prepare for and deliver employer and broker specific proposals and presentations based on: 
   
    Employer specific healthcare strategy, brokers, geographies, etc. understanding buyer/potential specifications 
    Centivo network/product features 
    Centivo's multi-year product and network strategy 
   
  Participate in broker and employer meetings/finalist presentations as a technical expert on Centivo's proposal/value proposition, including: 
   
    Pricing 
    Network 
    Performance guarantees 
    Customized offerings 
   
  Coordinate customized proposals, working across key business functions (network, product, analytics, operations, marketing) that integrate Centivo's offerings including: 
   
    Financial proposal with pricing/performance guarantees 
    Stop-loss coverage and pricing 
    Network details (geoaccess, network and disruption analyses) 
    Plan design modeling 
    Integration of specific programs/vendors 
    Member app/product customizations 
    TPA operational details 
   
  Serve as the internal expert for the sales team for key network/product tools and strategy (i.e. network mapping, census tool etc.) 
  For national accounts sold cases, support smooth transition and handoff to implementation and client success teams 
  
 You should have/be: 
  
  Advanced skills Excel and PowerPoint for sales presentations 
  Ability to cultivate strong relationships and credibility with partner organizations 
  Collaborative and able to work across an organization to accomplish goals 
  Comfortable with and excited by working in an early-stage environment; entrepreneurial spirit willingness to roll sleeves up 
  
 Education and Experience: 
  
  Bachelor's degree 
  5+ years of relevant healthcare experience 
 
 
   Who we are: 
   Centivo is an innovative health plan for self-funded employers on a mission to bring affordable, high-quality healthcare to the millions of working Americans who struggle to pay their medical bills. Anchored around a primary care based ACO model, Centivo saves employers 15 to 30 percent compared to traditional insurance carriers. Employees also realize significant savings through our free primary care (including virtual), predictable copay and no-deductible benefit plan design. Centivo works with employers ranging in size from 51 employees to Fortune 500 companies. For more information, visit centivo.com.   Headquartered in Buffalo, NY with offices in New York City and Buffalo, Centivo is backed by leading healthcare and technology investors, including a recent round of investment from Morgan Health, a business unit of JPMorgan & Co.
